My only problem with this hotel was their over-hyped restaurants especially Made In China which was really disappointing- service and food were not great and it was more expensive than other 5 star hotels in Beijing.

reviews.title: Hyatt Beijing shines

reviews.text: The Grand Hyatt Beijing is undoubtedly one of the best hotels in the city. The location is great, with Oriental Plaza shopping mall in the same building complex, and with Wangfujing shopping street right next door.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel with a fabulous pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is luxurious from its lobby to the gorgeous pool situated underground. The pool & spa services deserve a special mention: This is the most fabulous hotel pool I have come accross, regardless of being an inside pool. The whole balinese setting with cavelike grottos and several jacuzzis is simply amazing (please see photos of this hotel, you will see what I am talking about).
reviews.title: A brilliant hotel - worth every penny

reviews.text: What is not quite up to the same "ultimate luxury" standards are the rooms. The bathrooms are great, with separate bathtubs, showers and toilet areas, but the rooms, albeit stylish, are rather small in size and simple in looks.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel staff is eager to recommend "club room" option, but in this case the room itself is exactly same, the only added benefits are inclusive breakfast and 1 person (guest only - no visitors) access to the club lounge where during certain hours one may enjoy foods and drink.
reviews.title: First rate hotel - highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel in a great location. Great service.Great Pool. Great restaurants. 5-Star rooms.
reviews.title: Our home in Beijing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel in a perfect location. A modern, grand building located over a shopping mall and just a block away from a pedestrianized shopping street (with plenty of malls, stores incl. souvenirs, restaurants, supermarkets, etc) and easy walk from the Forbidden City and other tourist sites. The hotel offers all 5 star comforts, the lobby lounge is very nice with good food and drinks, restaurants are excellent (incl. the japanese and the buffet restaurant we tried) and rooms couldn't be better (stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, which is basically a large 2 bed apartment). Service is good, not perfect but as good as you can get in this area (staff's english could be better but that is a common problem in Chinese hotels).
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

likes.liked: — Fantastic room, perfect location, great building

reviews.text: We also stayed in the (more expensive) Four Seasons in Shanghai and the Beijing Grand Hyatt was better on all counts, including rooms and a far better service quality! Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Always impressive

reviews.text: Two tips: Try one of the heavenly smoothies from the breakfast menu (especially blueberry - the best I ever had) and for the more adventurous ones, the street food market nearby selling everything incl. grilled scorpions, silk worms, beetles and other yummies (surprinsingly these ended up being as expensive as restaurant dinners).
reviews.title: Great Location, average room.

likes.liked: — Location, right above the mall, and very close to major road arteries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Hyatt located on East Chang An Avenue. This is a good hotel, pricey but good. I have stayed here twice at different times of the year, and it was impressive on both occasions. The rooms are huge and scrupulously clean, and have absolutely everything you need.Dont even bring a toothbrush, they do the lot.
reviews.title: Bronze Medal - Mixed Reviews Durring Our Olympic Stay

reviews.text: I ate here three times each in different restauants in the hotel and all the food was good, nice bars, good coffee and a great staff. You can get access to one of the largest and most upmarket shopping malls directly from the hotel. If you wanted you might never need to go outside, which is a consideration given the pollution and frantic traffic that is Beijing.
reviews.title: The Best Yet

reviews.text: I had a remarkable stay at the Grand Hyatt Beijing. This is a hotel that not only has the "hardware" but also has the "software." All staff members were very well-trained, courteous, and service oriented. My rooms maid took very good care of my room and put the room in order several times a day. She paid attention to all the details including providing fresh glassware and folding the toilet paper. The food service was remarkable at this property. The breakfast buffet is great and operated by very well trained waitstaff. Upon entering they give you a newspaper and seat you, every time you go to the buffet they clear the plates and fold your napkin. You don't have to ask for coffee refill, they anticipate this and bring you refills. The restaurant manager Moritz keeps a vigilant eye on the operation and his staff responds to his leadership with a very high regard to the service provided to guests. Food quality is outstanding with great selections and imported food specialities. The common areas of the hotel are outstanding, beautiful, comfortable. The pool must be seen to be appreciated, it will blow your mind. Location of the hotel is outstanding, located next to a shopping mall and Wangfujing #1 line station right underneath. The mall also has a nice food court. In every respect, an outstanding hotel with outstanding well-trained and solicitious staff.
reviews.title: Runs Like a Well Oiled Machine

reviews.text: This is a great hotel with an incredible location just a few blocks (easy walking distance) from the Forbidden City and Tian an Men Square. I was visiting China for the first time and this was a very comfortable place to tour from.
reviews.title: Beautiful- best location for Beijing sightseeing, and most incredible pool

reviews.text: Also, this hotel has THE most incredible indoor pool I have ever seen anywhere.
reviews.title: It's good, but not the best.

reviews.text: We were 3 adults traveling with 2 kids( 3 1/2 boy and 1 year old girl). We stayed in a 2 bedroom room, it had a small kitchen, a small living room. The room itself was ok nothing amazing. The beds were confortable, the bathrooms were clean. However, the carpet was VERY DIRTY and for me, having a 1 year old that is a big concern.
reviews.title: A must if you need to stay in Bejing

reviews.title: Expensive but nice

reviews.text: The Grand Hyatt is the most conveniently located of the 5-star hotels in Beijing. It is a 10-minute taxi ride from Tiananmen Square, a 10-minute walk from Wangfujing (Beijing's main pedestrian shopping street), and right next door to Oriental Plaza, Beijing's largest indoor shopping mall.
reviews.title: Great location and a really great indoor pool

reviews.text: The hotels rooms are nice, but not exceptional. They were clean and modern, and had good large bathrooms. What makes the hotel special are it common areas, especially its large indoor swimming pool, which is one of the best in the world (we are not kidding!). The pool area is decorated like a tropical paradise, with simulated twinkling stars overhead. Adjacent to the pool is a spa and health club complex. The hotel's lobby is full of marble and has a pleasant seating area where you can enjoy a drink or snack. The front desk is friendly and efficient, and there is a helpful concierge desk. Enough staff members spoke English that we had no language problems. In addition, the hotel has a large full-service business center, which was user-friendly.
reviews.title: Hyatt, high prices, low everything else

reviews.text: There are a number of good restaurants in the hotel, although they are not cheap. If you want something more casual, there is a wide range of restaurants in the Oriental Plaza mall next door. The breakfast buffet at the Hyatt was excellent, with a good selection of hot and cold Asian and Western foods.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel

reviews.text: Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt and definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: You pay for what you get

likes.disliked: — The price was beyond my comfort zone.

My husband and I have just returned from a 10 day visit staying at the Hyatt and visiting our daughter who now studies in Beijing, and feel the property is overrated and overpriced.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay in Beijing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to thank tripadvisor.com for this one... a friend and I planned a side trip to Beijing during a business trip to China in 07. I selected this hotel based on user reviews and it exceeded my expectations. This hotel has everything... a gorgeous lobby, beautiful well appointed rooms, fabulous breakfast and the absolute perfect location to all in Beijing. Walking distance to the Forbidden City and many great restaurants.
reviews.title: Best hotel in China

likes.disliked: — nothing - I absolutely loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Go to My Humble House for dinner one night -- nearby the hotel. Food is outstanding and great ambience. The concierge recommended the restaurant and it was a hit! Concierge will arrange a car and tour guide for the great wall -- I highly recommend this. Taking a bus tour is not a great idea - you will really appreciate the one on one attention that the tour guide can offer.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Beijing

reviews.text: Again - amazingly beautiful hotel for a great price.
reviews.title: Made the trip even more wonderful!

reviews.text: This hotel is what every hotel in Beijing--and all of China--should be measured against. The location is perfect, the rooms are comfortable, and the swimming pool is paradise. There was even a wonderful breakfast restaurant in the Oriental Plaza mall called Paris Baguette that provided a relaxing atmosphere to start the morning off right. Every dollar spent at this hotel was well worth it.
reviews.title: WOW.......................

reviews.text: My parents & I went to Beijing in July - which was unbelievably hot & humid. It was the kind of weather when you sweat when you walked out the door!
reviews.title: great hotel for family with kids

reviews.text: It was our first Hyatt Stay, and our first family trip to China; and this place never disappointed.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in a huge city!

reviews.text: Unfortunately our stay started with our 2nd son falling and cutting his chin open. The attentive staff not only guided us to the nearby PUMC hospital, but helped us for at least 20 mins, translating and communicating what we needed to do and where we needed to go. After barely 2 hours after the fall, our son was stitched up (by an extremely capable doctor I must add) we were out of the hospital and at "Made in China" eating their famous and very very good Beijing Roast Duck!
reviews.title: Nice property - Fantastic pool - Worth a look...

reviews.text: The rooms were large, very well appointed, comfortable and just the place to rest and relax after each busy day. As we had a 2-Bedroom Accomodation, we had 2 Toilets and sizable living area. Each room had a large King Sized bed and enough space to walk around; enough to feel that you are in a big city.
reviews.title: Still excellent

reviews.text: As we were pressed for time, we spent each day running to the various sights in the City, from the Forbidden City to the Summer Palace; Hutongs and the Olympic Park. We tried as best we could to explore the areas around the hotel (We had chosen the hotel for it's rather central location), as the famous Wangfujing shopping district was just at the corner of the hotel... but this is one HUGE city, and even the corner felt like half a mile away...
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - One of the best in the Area

reviews.text: Unfortunately we also arrived during the May Day weekend and the city was filled with their own local tourists from all over China, and I have never seen so many people in so many places thorughout a trip before.
reviews.title: Just what you expect from a 5-star property
American class luxury in Beijing
reviews.text: The Grand Hyatt Beijing has an excellent location near the Forbidden City, Wanfujing Street, and attached to the Oriental Plaza, which has a large selection of shopping, restaurants, ATMS, and grocery story and good access to the subway. We purchased the family package, which provided a large 2 bedroom suite with separate living area and kitchen. One reason we chose the Grand Hyatt was their promising pool, but when we checked in, we were notified that it was closed for maintenance. There was zero postings on their website about this. They offered us swimming at the Park Hyatt, which is about a mile (and a 30 minute Beijing taxi ride) away which we declined after sitting in 2 hours of Beijing traffic coming from the airport but they did waive the 15% service charge for us. One nice feature is that you can pre-book tours on their website: we booked a Great Wall tour and acrobat show and this was super convenient for us. The rate included a buffet breakfast. Having sampled the breakfast buffet at many Asian hotels, I would say I was disappointed here, especially for the price of 750 RMB for our family of 2 adults and 2 children. The selection was acceptable but nothing that offered a wow factor. We did enjoy the Food Emporium in the basement of the OP, where we charged up our pre-paid card and enjoyed rice, noodle and dumpling dishes from around China for 18-22 RMB a plate.

We spent 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt in Beijing in April 2010. This hotel was fantastic for several reasons. First, they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite, which was beautiful. Second, they have a wonderful pool- our 7 & 4 year old would have loved to just stay at the hotel and swim the entire trip- best hotel pool (not resort pool) we have seen. Third, we have picky eaters, and China is not an easy place to travel to with picky eaters. This hotel was connected to a full out Mall- with a Dairy Queen, Pizza places, McDonalds...we would get the kids food and then we would all head out to get some traditional Chinese food together after...then the kids could have noodles and we could eat with happy kids. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with young children- the rooms were well kept up and very nice, the staff was very friendly...I do not have one bad thing to say about it!
reviews.title: Best Place to stay with young kids

reviews.text: I've spent here 10 days during my last business trip to China. The hotel is just 15 minutes far from Tienammen Square and there is a metro stop just under the building. Big suite, with a fantastic Internet connection (a bit expensive) without ANY limitation.
reviews.title: Fantastic for business and well connected with the center

reviews.text: A SPA is available but the POOL is closed for the annual cleaning. Great breakfast and the available service is really good: a taxi stop is organized outside the hotel to help customer to reach the correct destination (no taxi driver can speak English).
reviews.title: As expected, excellent service from the Grand Hyatt

reviews.text: I shall come to the point on the hotel: the Grand Hyatt is still one of the best business hotels. No specific dissatisfaction to express.
reviews.title: Glorious hotel in central Beijing close to many cultural sites and shopping.

reviews.text: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location in Beijing. It is about 15 minutes from Tiananman Square and across the road from the subway (metro) which I was able to take to the Temple of Heaven. Staff were efficient, and many spoke English. I was met at the airport by a charming lady who whisked me through very quickly. I did not realize at the time, but I left my e-reader in the car. The next day, there was a note under my door - we have found your e-reader, would you like us to deliver it to your room? Wow. I was impressed. The food was great, live piano music in the foyer, shopping mall attached to hotel. And the pool! I have never seen anything like it. I did not know about it, so did not bring my swimsuit. The most beautiful pool I have ever seen. Anywhere. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Highly recommend for business - but don't forget swimsuit

reviews.text: This hotel has good facilities...probably one of the best conference facilities in Beijing and the most amazing swimming pool ever. You will feel like you have been transported to another world when you enter the underground swimming pool/jacuzzi area.
reviews.title: Great swimming pool

description: Grand Hyatt Beijing is one of the finest hotels in Beijing and indeed China. In the prestigious Oriental Plaza in the centre of Beijing, the hotel is just minutes' walk from Tian An Men Square, the Forbidden City, the city centre and the Wang Fu Jing shopping street.
